Her dreams are to educate her three sons so that they can have a better quality of life and obtain a higher level of education that they can use to perform better in their work, businesses, etc., and so that they can be good persons in life.

Doña Maria is now applying for a loan with which she will buy 6 quintals [a quintal is approximately 100 lbs] of urea, 8 quintals of 18-46-0 fertilizer, 7 quintals of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 5 liters of foliar fertilizer, and 3 gallons of herbicides, with which she will strengthen her coffee crops, assuring the harvest at the end of the season and protecting it from pests and diseases such as rust.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies to maintain and help her coffee plantings

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.en:
Rajabgul is 52 years old. She is divorced and has 4 children. Rajabgul tries to provide them with a better quality of life, that’s why 3 years ago she began her own business, sewing traditional women's dresses. She has her own workshop in her house. 

Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to make a wedding party of her son. Her son is going to marry a lovely girl. 

Rajabgul does not have the money to make the wedding party for her son. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To make a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn is married with 2 children. She is 38 years old and lives in Mayor's Village, Clarin, in the province of Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Cherlyn operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to her local community. She has been doing this for years, and every month she earns 4,500.00 PHP from this work. Cherlyn has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC for the repair of her existing vehicle for better service. She requests a new loan of 10,000.00 to cover the costs of licenses and renewal for motor registration.

Cherlyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, she hopes to double her income from her business, and that her children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to cover the costs of licenses and renewal for motor registration.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Fransisca is a married woman with two school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Her dream is to open a cosmetic shop and be a clothes supplier.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to buy two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to buy two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother from Sangke district of Battambang province, Chan is 59 years old and has four children. She strives for a living via rice trading, buying in order to resell. 

Chan has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages, the past seven cycles. She has repaid her loan with success to support her living and her business better than before. Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more rice for resale. 

She hopes to stock more rice for resale so as she can get more income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Intan I Group

texts.en:
Intan group has completed the first cycle of the Kiva program and all goes well. In cycle two, one of its members temporarily is not borrowing. So, now there is a total of 17 in the Intan group, which has diverse businesses, such as selling clothes and shoes, selling snacks, soybean production, food stalls open for business, and raising goats for sale. 

The group members support each other and complement each other. If one member is ill, they will be raising funds to help offset the cost of treatment for the sick person. They will visit the sick person, while handling the fund. They will use this loan plan to buy wholesale, meaning better production because of increased business capital.

This group is led by a mother who is called Menik. She has three children who are still in school. Menik has a business selling clothes, bags, shoes and bed covers. With this loan, Menik has an additional hope to build her own store and add lots of the latest models of clothes and bags to be sold to the public. 

These loans are also expected to increase the business and the income of each of the group members of Intan.

loans.use: to buy lots of models of clothes, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married with two children, both of whom are going to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in her own shop to neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia lives in the capital city of Georgia with her grown son, daughter-in-law and an infant grandson. She is 59 years old and widowed. 

Lusia has been in the dressmaking business for the last twenty years and works for a small sartorial (tailoring business). She earns a monthly salary and feeds her family, but her earnings are too small and are not enough for covering other household expenses.

She is seeking a loan to buy a sewing machine and materials for tailoring. Lusia will work from her house after work and sew fashionable clothes, which will be sold at the local open market by her son. She will also work on special orders and serve the locals in return for a fee. 

The extra income that she raises from the business will improve her standard of living. Lusia hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
As a resident from Takeo province, Sopheap is a 44-year-old married mother of two children. Her main sources of income come from from rice cropping, cow-raising, as well as her monthly income working as government worker. In addition, the family earns income through her husband’s occupation as a policeman. The current business has returned her about US$6 per day to cover their daily food and other necessary expenses. 

Sopheap is not a new borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). After the successful loan that she has fully repaid, she can maintain her agribusiness well and keep supporting her children in school. 

Now, she is taking out a new loan in order to support her daughter, who is pursuing her bachelor degree majoring in accounting. The loan will be used to cover the tuition fee. She hopes that this loan will fulfill her daughter's dream of getting a good job that is suitable with an academic background.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is married with five children lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been farming for many years as their main source of income, while her husband makes a living as a part-time driver.

Loida has successfully repaid her previous loans from Gata Daku MPC which she used for the improvement of her farm. This month, she has borrowed a new loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure for her growing corn production. In the future, she hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her area of cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 54, is a widowed mother of six children who lives in a village in the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. She has been farming rice and raising pigs for several years.

This is the fourth loan Thon has taken through VisionFund. Having had a good experience with this lender, Thon is applying for a another loan, this one for 2,500,000 KHR, to spend on fertilizer for her crops and laborers to help her cultivate her farmland.

Thon really hopes that this loan will enable her to grow excellent rice so that she can sell her harvest for a higher amount. In this way Thon’s loans will help her family have a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for laborers on it

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tires for the extra-urban bus

loans.name: Kurbantaaji

texts.ru: Курбантажи 52 года, замужем, мать-героиня, воспитывает 5 детей (1 дочь, 4 сына). Курбантажи имеет средне-специальное образование, по специальности- бухгалтер. В настоящее время работает в больнице-бухгалтером, стаж работы 36 лет. Коллеги по работе описывают ее как: ответственного, целеустремленного, и доброжелательного человека. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие.  Курбантажи в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством на протяжении долгих лет, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Курбантажи в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 4 дойные коровы и 20 овец. Ее хозяйство приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Курбантажи вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Курбантажи обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Курбантажи планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена накопить средства для проведения свадьбы младшего сына.
texts.en: Kurbantaaji is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of a large family (one daughter and four sons). Kurbantaaji has graduated from a technical college and is an accountant by trade. At present she works as an accountant in a hospital. She has 36 years of work experience. Her colleagues describe her as a responsible, goal-oriented and thoughtful person. Her husband and children help her out in the household. She has a tight-knit family, with a very good family climate. As an additional source of income for her family, Kurbantaaji has been raising livestock for many years, having launched this business with a starting capital of 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Kurbantaaji’s hard work, she now has four dairy cows and 20 sheep. Her farm brings in about 10,000 KGS per month from sales of dairy products, which is the main source of covering costs of food and basic needs for her family. The income from her farm has allowed Kurbantaaji to raise her children and help them get started in life. In order to develop her farm further, Kurbantaaji has applied to the Bai Tushum & Partner microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle. Kurbantaaji plans to invest her revenues into a further growth of her farm. In the future, she also plans to save enough money to be able to pay for her youngest son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Channe's Group

texts.en: Channe, a resident of Battambang province where farming is the most popular business in the area, is 27 years old and married. She has four dependents to care for as two of them are in school and the remaining two are still little. Her entire family counts on a single business, rice farming on three hectares area. It is the business that she has had for eight years. This is the fourth microloan for Channe with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans with success to improve her living conditions so they are better than before. Now, she formed a group of two to get a new loan of 100,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy household appliances for her family. She hopes her kids can have the necessary household items that others have.

loans.use: To buy household appliances for her family.

loans.name: Kasenyi United- Kabira Group

texts.en: Ms. Kabira is 50 years old but still determined to work until she gets her dream in life. She is a member of Kasenyi United group, which is located in rural Ishaka near the landing site. She has so far borrowed seven times from UGAFODE through its Ishaka branch and has now applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to be able to boost her business by buying soft drinks. She is an enterprising lady who has seen her bar business grow from one level to another since 1980. In addition to the bar business, she has a restaurant, which gives her additional income. Kabira was motivated to start the business because she had enough money for the start up capital. Her clients are mainly people from the nearby locality and the locals of Kasenyi. Kabira is hard working and honest and this has helped her a lot to grow the business despite the challenges of Inflation and competition. She intends to use the money to buy more drinks and foodstuffs for her bar and restaurant, respectively, and she believes that the profit from the business will help her achieve her dream in life.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Lilliana

texts.es: Doña Lilliana es una clienta con 38 años de edad, casada y con hijos. Vive con su esposo e hijos. Trabajadora y con visión empresarial. Se ha especializado en su actividad por medio de cursos impartidos en el Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje. Se dedica al corte y confección de prendas de vestir tales como pijamas, ropa interior, vestidos de baño y más. También cose a la medida. Se ha caracterizado en la Fundación por su excelente moral de pago y responsabilidad. Es una empresaria que en éstos momentos necesita financiamiento para su salud. Necesita hacerse un tratamiento odontológico, el cual no tiene el dinero disponible para pagarlo, debido a que le sale un poco alto el costo, asi mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lilliana is a 38-year-old married mother of two who lives with her husband and children. She is a hard worker with a vision for business. She has specialized her work by taking courses through the National Apprenticeship Institute. Lilliana makes a living cutting and sewing garments like pajamas, underwear, swimsuits and other items, and she also makes clothes to measure. She is known within Fundacion Mujer for her excellent morals and responsibility with her payments. At this time, this businesswoman needs a loan for her health. She needs to get dental treatment and doesn't have money available to pay for it due to the high cost. In this way, she will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a dental procedure.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is married with two children and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City with her family. She operates a motorcycle transportation service to make a living. In addition to this, she also is engaged with her business buying and selling dried fish and longganisa (pork sausage) in town. She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a new set of motorcycle tires. She is thankful to GDMPC for helping her business run a better service. She will use the generated income for additional capital for her existing business and hopes for the general improvement of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of motorcycle tires

loans.name: Setha's Group

texts.en: Residing in Battambang province, Setha is 25 years old and takes care of her one little kid. Her main source of income is from her barbering business in the area. Her husband helps her generate additional income by working for others for a fee. She has been involved in her current business for three years, earning about 41,000 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  With the successful loans that she has repaid, she has improved her living conditions.  Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She and her co-borrower are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Setha will spend her loan portion to open a proper barber shop and to purchase necessary materials to support this business. She hopes to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase materials to open a proper barber shop

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla, 42, is the father of four children residing in Banteay Meanchey province. To support the daily food expenses, he does rice cropping while his wife sells vegetablea for extra income. He has been involved in his current business for ages and it has returned him about 35,000 KHR per day. This is not the original loan for Phalla with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has managed his past loan wisely to improve his business and sustain his living better than before. Now, he joins a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for his farmland. He hopes that he can make a good yield and gain a high profit better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for his farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Celia Ernestina's Group

texts.es:
La señora Olga Esther de estado civil casada tiene 40 años de edad, cursó 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 1 está estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, inició este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará parala compra de maíz para vender tortillas, inició este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, desea en el futuro que su negocio crezca y tener otros puestos para vender tortillas. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a venta de comida y al comercio.
texts.en:
Olga Esther, 40, is married and has four children, one of whom is in school.  She finished two years of elementary school.

Olga Esther makes a living selling tortillas.  She started this business with very little capital and now has five years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who works as a bricklayer.

She's organizing a group and requesting a loan to buy corn to sell tortillas.  She wants her business to grow in the future and to have other stalls to sell tortillas.

The other members of the group work selling food and in commerce.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Rhyme Rose

texts.en: Rhyme Rose is from Calabayan, Ozamis City. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Rhyme Rose is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Rhyme Rose has been in business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Aside from selling groceries, she is engaged in selling beauty products in her community to earn extra income. She borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional beauty products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Evangeline dreams of a business expansion and hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kimsov's Group

texts.en: Originally from Banteay Meanchey province’s Moung Russey district, Kimsov is a widowed mother of one independent child who is working in Thailand, Cambodia's neighbor country. Her main source of income is from one hectare of rice cropping, which has returned her about 24,400 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Kimsov with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to improve her business. Now, in a group of four, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy three sacks of potash for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and make more profit for her family so that she can buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her crop husbandry.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of potash for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna has been involved in agriculture for five years. She is a widow and a mother of two sons.
 
Susanna's farm currently includes one mother pig and four piglets and she owns a plot of agricultural land where potato is cultivated.

Susanna has requested this loan because her barn is too old and needs to be renovated. She also needs financial support to purchase forage and feed the livestock. The loan from Kiva lenders will greatly assist Susanna, as she will be able to work hard and enlarge the number of livestock in her newly renovated barn.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the barn and to purchase forage for the livestock

loans.name: Glenda Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Glenda tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos,  vive en su casa propia ubicada en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en la zona centro de Honduras, es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable.
Doña Glenda se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 17 años, sus ventas son de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana le ayuda su hermana a vender, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su colonia.
Doña Glenda está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, grava, varillas, madera, clavos, alambre, piedra, etc. porque quiere realizarle unas mejoras a la habitación donde vive.
Doña Glenda espera que esta inversión y ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en: Glenda is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their four children in their own home located in a barrio of Tegucigalpa in central Honduras. She is a very feisty and responsible woman. Glenda has made a living making and selling tortillas for the past 17 years. She sells Monday-Friday, and on the weekends her sister helps her. Her customers are friends and neighbors. Glenda is requesting the loan to purchase bricks, cement, gravel, wood, nails, wire, stone and other materials because she wants to make some improvements to her home. Glenda hopes this investment will help improve her family's quality of life a little.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, gravel, wood, nails, wire, stone, etc. for her home.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is 37 years old. She is an entrepreneur who is divorced and has three children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than three years. Little by little with the passing of time she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the good condition of the animals, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad about her work. 

Gulbahor is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, in this way she will be able to offer her son access to a better quality education and financial stability that will allow him to progress. She is asking for a loan of 7500 somoni to buy young cattle for developing her business further. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw meat, fish, chicken, and condiments

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en: Oeurn is 48 years old and blessed with four children. Nowadays, only one son still depends on her as he is in school. She makes a living via cassava farming and working for others for a fee. To supplement the family income, her husband also runs a small motorbike repairing store. She has had her business for 28 years and it has returned 36,000 KHR to her per day. Oeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past four cycles. She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to support her business with a decent income in return to improve her living. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and to pay the plowing fee for her crops. She hopes that she can make more income so she can be better off in her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicide, and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 60 años de edad, está divorciada y vive cómodamente en su casa propia en compañía de 02 de sus hijos de 22 y 28 años de edad respectivamente. Rosario se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desechos de maderas de las madereras cercanas. Tiene un espacio cerca a las madereras donde apila sus maderas y los prende fuego dejandolo quemar por varios días. Se inicio hace más de 30 años, empezando de a poco con un capital propio que fue haciendo crecer con bastante esfuerzo, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos en la preparación y venta del carbón.Se decidió con este negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a su familia ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos logrando sacarlos adelante. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento. Este será su sexto préstamo con Kiva y está contenta con el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones que son los desechos de madera buscando precios bajos para sus compras en volumen.
texts.en: Rosario is 60 years old, divorced and lives comfortably in her own home with her two children ages 22 and 28. She makes a living making and selling wood-based charcoal made from scraps from nearby timber mills. She has a space near the mills where she stacks her wood and lets it burn for a few days. She started the business more than 30 years ago, starting out with a little of her own capital that she was able to grow with a lot of hard work. At the moment, she relies on the support of her children to prepare and sell the charcoal. She needs this business to earn income to provide for her family, since she is both mother and father to her children and she wants them to keep moving forward. Therefore, seeing the good results and profits from the business, she wants to continue working since it's her only source of income. This will be her sixth Kiva loan, and she is pleased with the support she receives to keep making headway. She promises to make her payments on time. With the loan, she plans to purchase wood scraps to make her charcoal, buying in bulk to get lower prices.

loans.use: to purchase scraps of wood at wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La Joven Ana tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en su casa propia ubicada en un barrio de Tegucigalpa en la zona centro de Honduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora.
Ana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años, sus ventas son los fines de semana y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su colonia, también de lunes a viernes trabaja en un empresa como vendedora y esto le genera otros ingresos para su hogar.
Ana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de harina, leña y también quiere comprar ropa usada como blusas, pantalones, camisas, etc. para iniciar con este otro negocio.
Ana espera que esta inversión y ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia y en un futuro espera que su negocio sea uno de los mas reconocidos de la zona.



Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Ana, 22, is a young single mother with two dependent children.  She lives in her own house located in a neighborhood of Tegucigalpa in the central part of Honduras.  She's a very hardworking woman.

Ana has earned a living making and selling tortillas for eight years.  She sells on the weekend and her customers are the neighbors and friends of her community.  She also works Monday through Friday in a company as a vendor, which generates additional income for her household.

Ana's requesting the loan to buy flour and firewood.  She also wants to buy used clothing such as blouses, pants, and shirts to start her other business.

Ana hopes that this investment helps her improve her family's quality of life a little and that in the future her business will be one of the best known in the area.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras, August 2013

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, and clothing

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela, 63, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her family. Rosela and her husband own and operate a farming business to earn a living. They plant and harvest rice for consumption and sell a portion of it for their needs. She has been in this business for years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC and it gave the farm improvement. Now, she requests another loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase fertilizer. She been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. She previously accessed a 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit (see footnote). Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a new 22,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha hopes to have additional jeepneys and dreams to help her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Footnote: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn. They modified the jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Freya Mariela

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Desde hace 14 años su mamá laboraba cocinando almuerzos y ella la ayudaba en la cocina.  De esta forma aprendió el negocio y lo ejerce hasta el día de hoy dado a que le ha resultado muy productivo.  Trabaja sola todos los días, de 8 am a 2 pm.  No es casada pero tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años, quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal.  Ahora necesita el crédito para comprar medicina para un tratamiento.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Surburbio sector of Guayaquil. Her mother had been preparing lunches for 14 years and she helped out in the kitchen. This was how she learned this business and now she remains very productive in this line of work. The borrower works alone every day from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. She is not married, but she has two children (ages 14 and 12) who attend a state school.

At the moment, the borrower needs a loan so that she can buy medicine for her treatment.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Geoconda Deyanira

texts.es: Geoconda es originaria de la ciudad Estelí. Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace mucho tiempo, empezó este negocio junto a su mama quien le heredo la tienda de ropa para que ella la administrara lo cual ha sido rentable. En este negocio la apoya su esposo y familia.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar: pantalones, zapatos, blusas, camisas, faldas y vestidos. Ella tiene como expectativa mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia. Su plan futuro es ampliar su negocio para abastecer a todos sus clientes con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y llegar a ser una empresaria reconocida por su trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Geoconda is originally from the city of Estelí. She is a merchant who has been selling new and used clothing for a long time. Geoconda started this business with her mother, who inherited a clothing shop to manage so that it would become profitable. She operates this business with the help of her husband and family.

Geoconda is requesting a loan in order to buy trousers, shoes, blouses, shirts, skirts, and dresses. She expects to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Her plan for the future is to expand her business so that she can cater to all of her customers in hopes of increasing her income and becoming a well-known businesswoman for her work and efforts.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shoes, blouses, shirts, skirts, and dresses.

loans.name: Yut's Group

texts.en:
Yut is 55 years old and a widowed mother of three children. Now, she is cassava grower on a 1-hectare area. She can earn up to 21,400 KHR (Cambodian riels) to cover her daily basic needs. 

This is not the first loan for Yut with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has utilized her past loan wisely to support her crops seasonably. She is now joining a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees, weeding fees, reaping fees and to buy insecticide for her crops. She hopes to gain triple yield from her crops and make more income.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, weeding fees, reaping fees and to buy insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Sreysaing's Group

texts.en:
Sreysaing is a breadwinner in the family consisting of two children in school. She is a hardworking farmer who does cassava farming on a 1-hectare area to support her living by using her income of about 19,400 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is a fourth-loan-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has utilized her past loan wisely to timely support the needs of her crops. Currently, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion of 1,200,000 KHR, out of the entire group amount of 2,400,000 KHR, in order to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for weeding fees and plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crops and makes a good income for the sake of her kids.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for weeding fees and plowing fees.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar pun nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para el cultivo de maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros para la segunda cosecha.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a adquirir los materiales agrícolas para la agricultura y con las ganancias han logrado a portar para su familia. Su deseo es siempre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y con la alimentación.
texts.en:
José has chosen to request a new loan because he needs more operating capital for planting corn and beans. This investment will help him to buy needed farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, and other items for his second crop.

His previous loan helped him to acquire supplies for farming and the profit he earned was used to support his family. His wish is to always help his children by educating and feeding them.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, and other supplies.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en:
Aged 53, Len is a widowed mother who has been growing cassava for over 30 years to feed her small family. To supplement her income, she also owns a small grocery stall.  

Len and her other group members are new to VisionFund. As the group leader, Len requests the loan to buy fertilizers for her cassava farm and to replenish more grocery items for her stall. Len hopes this loan will enable her to make more money so that she can expand her business and, as such, generate more profit for her kids' future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and more grocery items.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single mother of three children, ages 12, 9 and 7. She is 32 years old and recently relocated from her hometown of Lusaka to set up her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Chipata, a town located 760 kilometers away from her hometown.

Grace believes in hard work. Every morning, she wakes up motivated by the fact that soon her business will grow bigger and enable her to take better care of her children. However, she faces a few challenges, one of which is a lack of working capital. She is currently operating her money transfer business with a minimum working capital of $2,000. This is not hardly enough for her to serve her customers with ease, as she is constantly running out of cash and losing out on profits.

This is Grace’s first Kiva loan. She plans to use her loan to add on to her working capital float so that she can grow her business and bring in enough revenue to allow her to send money back home to her mother, who is currently taking care of her children while she settles down in Chipata.

Grace dreams of becoming the biggest Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Chipata. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can serve more customers and grow her Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Marta Argentina

texts.es: Marta, tiene 24 años de edad, esta soltera y ella vive sola en el municipio de San Manuel, Cortes. Anteriormente estudiaba y hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y mercadería por encargo como ropa interior, blusas, sandalias, zapatos, cremas, champú  y otros. Estos productos los vende en su casa y a domicilio. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en  la compra de mercadería para el negocio como cosméticos, zapatos y ropa, con el fin de poder cumplirles a los clientes que han hecho pedidos. El plan es mantener esta actividad que le genere ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta is 24 years old, single, and lives alone in the town of San Manuel, Cortes. She was previously a student, but has now been selling cosmetics and merchandise to order for the past three years. Marta offers undergarments, blouses, sandals, shoes, crèmes, shampoo, and other products. She sells these items from her home.

The loan she is requesting is for 8,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her business such as cosmetics, shoes, and clothing so that she can fulfill the orders that her customers have placed. Her plan is to maintain this business so that she can generate income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su familia, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz, maicillo, frijol adicional a su trabajo se dedica a la albañilería, es una persona servicial, trabajadora, honesta y luchadora con ganas de salir adelante, realizando esta actividad ayuda a su familia a  solventar algunos gastos de su casa, el cliente  solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos como semilla, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas,  etc.  y así obtener mayores ingresos y  mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in his own home with his family. He has been farming for several years and his main crops are corn, sorghum, and beans. He also works as a bricklayer. The borrower is a helpful, hardworking, honest, and determined individual who has the drive to get ahead. He engages in this line of work so that he can help his family pay for a few of the household expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies needed to maintain his crops such as seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, and other items. This will help him generate more income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
A local farmer from Ponhea Leur district of Kampong Cham province, Mom is 35 years old and has six children. Mom grows rice on 1 hectare to support her primary basic needs in the family. This is the business that she has had for 10 years.

 With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a second-time borrower, and she has repaid her first loan with success. For this loan cycle, she is seeking a microloan to pay her son’s tuition fee to pay for driving lessons for her son. She hopes that her son can get a driving license after finishing the studies and get a paid job to get more income.

loans.use: To pay her son’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 33 years old and married. She has three children in school to support. She makes a living via working at a garment factory and does rice cropping on a 1-hectare area. To help her in earning a decent income, her husband plays traditional music during wedding events and drives a motor-taxi. 

Vanna is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking this loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to her workplace. She hopes that she can reduce relevant expenses on transportation costs and use this motorbike to transport her kids to school as well.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is from Yeghnik village, where she lives with her daughters and husband. The family has been involved in a cattle-breeding business for many years. They keep cows, pigs, piglets and chickens. Hamset also cultivates barley and grass. Unfortunately, the grass is not enough for feeding the livestock, so Hamest needs financial support for purchasing grass and feed for the animals. She has requested this loan for that purpose and hopes that Kiva lenders will support her.

Hamest is a very hardworking and responsible women who does her best to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Jayvan

texts.en:
Jayvan studies BSEE at Southern Mindanao Colleges in Zamboanga del Norte. He is 22 years old and married with an only child. His father had a fishing business and a rice farm for their living. On vacations and weekends, he helped his father go fishing and also helped with weeding maintenance and harvests in their farm. Despite having a kid at a younger age, he makes every effort possible in order to continue. 

He borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Gata Daku MPC to pay for school tuition fees. He wants to be successful in order to give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn is 44 years old and married with one daughter and two sons. She and her family live in a village in the Ponhea Krek district. Khorn and her husband have been farming cassava for 24 years. She also runs a small grocery store to make additional income for the family. 

Khorn is a new borrower with VisionFund. She leads a group of four members to apply for loans, of which her loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR (Cambodian riels). As the leader, she will spend her portion on fertilizer for her farmland and add more grocery items for reselling. She hopes to grow a good yield of crops and make more profit so that she can fulfill her dream of planting rubber trees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en:
Mwinyi is thankful for the previous loan he received from Kiva that enabled him to receive profits he used to take care of his family.
Mwinyi is a very hardworking man who wants to improve his family's living standards.  He is requesting a loan of KES10,000 to purchase maize, beans, rice,sugar and detergents for his business.
He joined Yehu to access loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, rice,sugar and detergents for his business

loans.name: Maileen Rose

texts.en:
This is Maileen Rose. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the grocery items needed for her variety store. Her income from this business helped in their everyday expenses at home. She has been in this business for five years now. She keeps working to provide for her family's everyday needs. She also has an electronic loading station for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial boost with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maileen Rose hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to give a good life to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Aged 30 and a married mother of four children—two schoolchildren and two little kids, Mom (her name) is a local farmer who undertakes rice farming on a half hectare of land as her primary source of income. Her husband uses his spare time to catch fish to sell as additional income. She has been involved in this current business for the last seven years, earning 19,000 KHR per day. Mom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the five past cycles. Her past loans , which she has already repaid completely, have supported her business and improved her standard of living. Additionally, she was able to save and buy a boat to support her husband's business as well. Now, she is leading a group of four to request a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, as well as gasoline for her hand-tractor to plow her farmland. She hopes that she will have a high yield and can sell the harvest for a high profit in order to buy cows for raising to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, as well as gasoline for her hand-tractor to plow her farmland

loans.name: Lem's Group

texts.en: Living in a Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Lem is aged 43 and married. She has seven children. Two daughters and two sons are still in school. Farming rice on two hectares of her farmland is her main source of income. Having been in this business for over 20 years, she is able to earn around 22,700 KHR per day to support her family. Lem has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and she has completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to better support her family and her children’s studies. Now she and her group member are applying for another loan. As the leader, Lem is going to use her portion to pay for farming expenses such as buying fertilizer, land cultivating and so on. She hopes this loan will enable her to prosper in her business and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To spend on rice farm cultivation

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en: Phoeurn is 33 and single. She is a local rice farmer. This is her main source of income. She has been involved in this current business for 10 years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Phoeurn is in her eighth cycle and her past loans have improved her standard of living and have allowed her to save and buy a water pump for her crops. Now, she is the leader of this group of six. For Phoeurn, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer as well as gasoline for her hand-tractor for her farmland. She strongly believes that she will gain a good yield to get more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer as well as gasoline for her hand-tractor for her farmland

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch, aged 45, is married and has five children, one of whom is still in school. Pig-raising is the single source of the family’s income and she has been in this business for ten years. Touch is the leader of her three member group and this is their second loan with VisionFund. Touch has successfully repaid the previous loan which has improved her family’s living condition. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pig feed. She hopes to earn a larger income so as to buy more pigs to further increase her income.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es  Miryan mujer de 37 años de edad, acompañada, con cuatro hijos que dependen de ella de 19, 14, 13 y 12 años, su negocio es la venta de leña desde hace 10 años, su compañero le ayuda a comprar la leña y posteriormente rajarlas en  pequeños manojos  para después venderla. Tiene 1 año de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo solicita para comprar troncos  de leña al por mayor. María mujer de  34 años de edad su negocio es un taller de costura y Blanca mujer de 39 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de bolsos y zapatos.
texts.en: The group comprises three small business owner, one of whom is Miryan, a 37-year-old woman who is in a relationship and has four children who are dependent on her, aged 19, 14, 13 and 12. She has been selling firewood for the last 10 years. Her partner helps her to buy the wood and slice it so it can be made into small bunches to sell.  She has been a customer of the institution for one year now, and she is requesting this loan to buy logs at wholesale. The other members of the group are María, a 34-year-old woman who has a dressmaking business, and Blanca, a 39-year-old woman who sells bags and shoes.

loans.use: to buy logs at wholesale to sell for firewood.

loans.name: Los Pellines Group

texts.es: Ana, quien  es la cuarta persona de izquierda a derecha que están de pie, ojos cerrados  y con una gran sonrisa, es socia del Banco Comunal Los Pellines de Castro, ubicada en la provincia de Chiloé, de la Región de los Rios. En este banco hay distintos rubros dentro de los cuales destacan el comercio de productos del mar, productos agrícolas y minimarket. Ana tiene un minimarket hace 4 años. Fue una inversión que hizo con un finiquito que le dieron por el término de un trabajo, y ante lo cual decidió, dejar de trabajar para demás personas y también tener más tiempo en su casa, cuenta que solo pudo comprar una caja de huevos algunas bebidas y algunos confites. Este último tiempo ha tenido problemas ya que el invierno ha sido muy fuerte en su sector por lo cual ha ayudado a que la cesantía aumente y así   las compras en su negocio no suban tanto, pero ella esta esperanzada en que todo se arreglará. Solicitará el dinero para poder abastecer su negocio en helados y bebidas, y espera  que le vaya muy bien. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de encontrar gente tiene sus mimos intereses y así también poder conocer más a los socios que componen el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Ana, the fourth person standing from the left with her eyes closed and a big smile, is a member of the 'Pellines de Castro' communal bank from Chiloé province in the Los Rios region. The members are involved in several trades, including seafood, agricultural products and 'minimarkets' (convenience stores). 

Ana has a minimarket business which she started 4 years ago. It was an investment she made with severance money received from a previous job. Before leaving her job, she had decided that she wanted to work for herself and spend more time at home. She tells us that at the time she was only able to buy a carton of eggs, some drinks and some candy. She has recently experienced some difficulties as the winter has been very harsh, leading to increased unemployment and therefore her sales have not increased much, however she remains hopeful that everything will work out. 

Ana is seeking this loan to purchase ice creams and beverages to stock her store, and believes that her business to do very well. What Ana likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is meeting others with similar interests, and also getting to know her fellow members in the communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and ice creams

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia, 54 years old, is married to a bus driver and they are blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in her village for nearly 30 years. With this business, she earns a net income of PHP 25,000 when they harvest string beans every two months and every four months when they harvest eggplant and squash. 

Verginia wants to expand and develop her business. This is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase vegetable seedlings for her business. She hopes that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is a young farmer from the village of Artabuynk in the Vayost Dzor region. He lives with his parents, sister and brother whom he has been involved with in agriculture for seven years. The family keeps cows, chickens and six colonies of bees as well as grows apricots, nuts, apples and pear trees. 

Despite his young age, Tigran is very skilled in the agricultural business and works really hard to sustain his family.

Now, this young and enthusiastic farmer needs your help in order to buy three oxen and fertilizer to enable him to enlarge his farm.

Tigran waits for your support.

loans.use: to buy three oxen and fertilizer.

location.town: Artabuynk village of  Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognontala, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de  boissons, du charbon de bois, des produits cosmétiques et des articles divers de boutique à l’image de Bintou. Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement les sept précédents.                                                    
Bintou, la première assise à droite compte acheter avec son prêt,  5 cartons de sachets de lait en poudre, 3 cartons de thé, 2 sacs de sucre, 2 cartons de biscuits de différentes sortes et 1 carton de bonbons, auprès des grossistes de Fana. Bintou revend à Fana, en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen  de 25.000 FCFA par mois, qui sera divisé en deux, une partie sera utilisée pour les dépenses de la famille et l’autre  réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group is made up of married women who average 37 years of age, with three children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in clothing, drinks, charcoal, cosmetics and, in the case of Bintou, miscellaneous shop products. The women in the Kotognontala group are on their eighth group loan having repaid the previous seven loans in full.

Bintou, who is sitting on the far right in the photo, is planning to buy five cartons of powdered milk sachets, three cartons of tea, two sacks of sugar, two cartons of various sorts of biscuits and a carton of candies with her loan. She will buy these products from wholesalers in Fana and resell them also in Fana, on a retail basis, for cash and sometimes on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA which will be divided into two, one half being used for the family's expenses and the other reinjected into her business.

loans.use: to buy various products for her shop.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 25 novembre 2003 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, de bonnes relations  basées sur la solidarité et l’entre aide.

Madame Mariama (debout à l’extrême droite et en médaillon vers le bas) est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère  d’une fille et de quatre garçons. Elle est  très enthousiasme, elle fréquente les marchés hebdomadaires où elle achète et revend de l’huile de palme et autres produits agricoles.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter une quantité assez importante de bidons d’huile de palme pour la revente au détail.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very committed women who have, since the creation of the Banc Villageois on 25th November 2003, managed to develop a good relationship based on solidarity and helping each other out, on top of building up their income-generating activities, which are principally in the form of small trading activities.

Mariama, who is standing on the far right of the photo and in the inset towards the bottom right, is the star borrower of this group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to a girl and four boys. She is very enthusiastic and attends the weekly markets where she buys and sells palm oil as well as other farmed products.

Her new loan will enable her to buy a fairly substantial quantity of containers of palm oil to resell on a retail basis. With the profits she is planning to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a fairly substantial amount of palm oil to resell on a retail basis.

loans.name: Aissatou Commandant's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 25 novembre 2003 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, de bonnes relations  basées sur la solidarité et l’entre aide.

Madame Aïssatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère 05  enfants dont un garçon et quatre filles. Elle est vendeuse de banane, et d’huile de palme, qu’elle achète dans un village où les femmes tiennent une plantation à 10 500 F CFA le sac.  Pour la revente par tas de 200 F CFA voir plus.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter quels que paniers de bananes et de l’huile de palme pour la revente.

En plus de renforcer son épargne pour bénéficier de prêt plus important, elle compte soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very committed women who, since the creation of the Banc Villageois on 25th November 2003, have managed to develop a good relationship based on solidarity and helping one another out, as well as building up their income-generating activities, which are principally in the form of small trading businesses.

Aïssatou, who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to five children: one boy and four girls. She sells bananas and palm oil, which she buys in a village where the women have a plantation and sell at 10,500FCFA per sack. She resells at 200FCFA or more per pile.

With her new loan she is planning to buy several baskets of bananas and palm oil for resale. As well as building up her savings to benefit from an even larger loan, she plans to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy several baskets of bananas and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Moul

texts.en:
Moul, 37, is a hard-working woman who has managed a vending business in the busiest market in Tuek Phos district of Kompong Chhnang, one of the central provinces of Cambodia. She has a sales stand, where she sells corn, fish and pork and she can earn a considerable income to support her family consisting of six members. Her husband serves as her motivation by giving her a helping hand. She has been in this business for close to 10 years.

She will now request a loan for KHR 3,000,000, which she will use to invest in the purchase of corn, fish, and pork to boost her sales. She is happy and thankful for the loan granted in order for her to be able to go far in her business.

loans.use: to invest for the purchase of corn, fish, and pork to boost her sales.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 40-year-old married mother of two. She has been working in selling perfumes and accessories for three years at her house. Abir is a hard working woman, who puts so much effort to provide both her family and customers with the best care and service. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special bags, accessories and perfumes with a new released collection.

This loan will help her develop her business more, to keep her customers pleased and satisfied. Abir hopes that one day she might use a future loan to open a separate shop outside her house, because at the present time she is not financially capable of taking this step.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special bags, accessories and perfumes with new released collection.

loans.name: Boeun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural town in the Battambang province and Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Boeun is 26 years old and married with one daughter who is too young for school. 

Boeun has been planting rice for five years. The current business returns her about 21,700 KHR per day to support her family's daily expenses. This is the third loan for Boeun and her other group member. The first loan allowed Boeun to sufficiently feed her family. As the leader, Boeun will use her second loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes that she can produce a higher crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en: A villager from the Sa Ang district of the Kandal province, Mach is 44 years old and single. She strives to make a living via rice farming. She has been involved in her current business for 21 years, earning about 22,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Mach as she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) previously. Her successful past loan has enabled her to support her business and her living conditions well. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She and her co-borrower are seeking a loan of 800,000 KHR each. For Mach, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Santa Esther

texts.en: Esther has been a client of Finance Sudan Limited since the year 2011. She heard about Finance Sudan through some group members within her locality. She is 25 years of age and a mother of two children. One child goes to school. Esther is a tailor who makes clothes for both men and women. She has been in this business for quite some time now and has employed one person to help her. She is borrowing a loan worth 3,000 South Sudanese Pounds to help her buy more cloth in her tailoring shop. She intends to use the money to even buy new machines and other materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and material for making clothes.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Kim, one of the breadwinners in the family consisting of seven borrower members, is 61 years old and a resident from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. To support her living, she grows rice and plants water spinach. This business has returned her about 25,000 KHR per day. Kim is the second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely, which has improved her business better than before. Now, in a group of five, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seven sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can make more income so that she can expand both businesses on a bigger scale.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, vive actualmente con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, los cuales están estudiando, tres de ellos en el centro escolar y uno en el Instituto. Ella, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos junto con su esposo, oficio que lo aprendió con sus padres y lleva 26 años de llevarlo a cabo. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros para la siembra de la postrera y el fortalecimiento del que tiene en proceso. Esta inversión le ayudara a darle un mejor mantenimiento al cultivo.
Su sueño es que sus cosechas sean abundantes y así ir mejorando su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Erlinda lives with her husband and four children who are students. Three of them go to primary school and the other one to secondary school. She grows grains together with her husband, an activity she learned from her parents. She has been doing this for 26 years.

Erlinda is requesting a loan to buy the agricultural supplies she needs, such as compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc. This will strengthen her current harvest and will be beneficial for the next one. With this investment, she will be able to maintain her crops better.

Her dream is to have abundant harvests and in this way improve her life.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
Santiaga,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos económicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima para el comedor y la venta de tortillas, tales como: maíz, carne, pollo, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, entre otros preparativos para la elaboración de comida. 
Con el crédito anterior tuvo un impacto positivo, ya que sus ventas aumentaron debido al fortalecimiento del negocio. Cuenta que se mantiene el mismo grupo familiar a diferencia que tanto su familia como el negocio disfruta de más oportunidades, ya que es rentable y tienen mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santiaga has the need of taking out another loan because the previous loan helped her grow her income. This investment will help her to buy raw materials for her restaurant and tortilla shop. She will buy things such as: corn, beef, vegetables, seasonings, beverages, and other ingredients to make the food.  

The previous loan had a positive impact because her sales increased because her business was strengthened. She says that her family is the same but both her family and her business have enjoyed more opportunities because it is profitable, and they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beef, chicken, vegetables, seasonings, beverages, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña esperanza de 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 18 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Esperanza solicita un crédito  para la compra de frutas como mamones, naranjas, jocote, limones, anona,, etc. por mayor para obtener mejores ganancias y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Esperanza is 57 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and her 18 year old son who is in school. For 20 years she has sold fruit and vegetables. Her business is located in her residence and with it she obtains income to pay for some household expenses. Esperanza is asking for a loan to buy fruit such as mamon, oranges, jocote, lemons, anona,, etc. wholesale to obtain more income and with this she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as mamon, oranges, jocote, lemons, anona,, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Lucia Norelia

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Lucia se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Nutrición Humana.
Por iniciativa propia, Lucia trabaja todo como representante comercial de una empresa de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa,ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Lucia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir para su venta, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa comercial.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 21 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and siblings. She is a person who is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic and who really wants to get ahead. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her parents, Lucia is studying Human Nutrition at college.  

On her own initiative, Lucia works as a sales representative at a business in her city. In addition, she also sells clothes. She works around 8 hours every day and she thinks it is going well for her because of her dedication and her good performance. Lucia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will buy a larger quantity of clothing to sell. This way, she will continue working  and striving to achieve her dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and she resides in the community surrounding around Airport. She is married and has nine children between 13 to 33 years old. Only three are in currently attending school and living at home. 

For the past 25 years she been selling red oil, Kool-Aid,  juice and other items. One problem she faces is the rainy season. She started this business by selling for her mother, and later she established her own business. She sells for six days a week, spending 8 hours a day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase red oil, Kool-Aid,  juice, and other items for her business. Her plan is to build herself a house. She would like to thank the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase red oil, Kool-Aid,  juice, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Samang's Group

texts.en:
Samang, 34, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district in Cambodia. Two of her children are dependent on her and still in school. To feed the family, Samang has been selling Khmer noodles, while her husband has been a paid worker and cassava grower, for 10 years, earning about 7,500 KHR per day to spend for family’s needs. 

Samang has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back her past loans. Samang has used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood and keep her children in school. She is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Samang is going to use her portion to buy household supplies for her family to use. She hopes to have enough household supplies for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy household supplies her family to use.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok is 60 years old and a citizen from Kandal province’s Sa Ang district. She has three children who are working in a local casino. She solely counts on her family business, rice farming, to get a decent income for her family. 

Pok is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is applying for her first loan to buy an additional plot of farmland, rice seed and insecticide, and to lease a plowing machine. She hopes to gain a good income, better than before.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland, rice seed and insecticide, and to lease a plowing machine.

loans.name: Kaltrain

texts.en:
Kaltrain is 29 years old, and lives in the community surrounding  Airport. She completed grade 12 and has two children, aged 6 months and 8 years old. Only the older one is in school, and they all live at home.

For the past ten years she has been selling red oil, plantain, banana, meat, etc., in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiance, and she learned trading from her friends. She likes how her business makes her independent. She spends ten hours on her business from Monday to Saturday. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, plantain, banana, meat, etc., for her business. She hopes to build her own house. She is glad to be a borrower of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, plantain, banana, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente en casa propia con sus padres, él se dedica  a la venta de café granulado, desde hace más de dos años, el distribuye su  producto en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy responsable, respetuosa, amable y servicial con sus clientes, esto lo ha llevado a lograr gran demanda  de sus productos ya que son de muy buena calidad y con un excelente sabor y precio, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos. El cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de paquetes de café por mayor para seguir comercializándolo, y de esta manera abastecer la gran demanda que posee, y así obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with his parents in the house that he owns. 

For more than two years now he has earned a living selling ground coffee. He sells his product in different markets that are near his place of residence. He is a very responsible individual who is respectful, friendly and helpful to his customers. This has led to a high demand for his products because they are of excellent quality, taste and price. Thanks to his work he has managed to cover some of his expenses. 

The borrower requests a loan to purchase packages of coffee wholesale to continue selling and, thus, to satisfy the high demand. This will increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy packages of coffee wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a divorced mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from her home to neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama is 30 years old and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She and her fiancé live together along with their four children who are from 3 to 10 years old. Three of her children are in school. Her fiancé works with Firestone security. She did not attend school but she is good at managing her business, which she has been doing for over seven years now. 

She described herself as a hardworking woman. She received a little money from her fiance to established her business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit and has more customers. She sells for ten hours six days a week. She is requesting a loan to buy more fufu (cassava base) and palm nut for her business. Her plans is to increase her business even more. She likes to say thanks to the supporter of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more fufu (cassava base) and palm nut for her business.

loans.name: Esau Antonio

texts.es:
