Esau tiene 26 años de edad, es bachiller, esta soltero, vive con sus padres. Desde hace dos años y medio trabaja como vendedor en una comercial, cuando termino su bachillerato le salio la oportunidad de trabajar ahí y no lo pensó dos veces para empezar, a pesar que no tenia experiencia. Actualmente solo se dedica a este negocio. Su lugar de trabajo esta a 3 km de su casa, pero se moviliza a otras ciudades cercanas para ir a vender, su horario de trabajo es de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar una motocicleta, la que le beneficiara porque se movilizara mas fácilmente a su lugar de trabajo. Así mismo, cuando se le presenta improvistos tiene que viajar hasta la cuidad y el sistema de transporte es muy irregular; por lo que tiene que realizar viajes de todo el día y con su motocicleta el tiempo de desplazamiento sera mas rápido y no perderá todo el día en viajar; ya que recorre aproximadamente 45km. 

 Los sueños que ha pensado concretizar para un futuro es instalar su propio negocio y específicamente una comercial de la cual ya posee experiencia en esta actividad  y sabe que tiene que trabajar fuerte para lograrlo, porque en el momento que decida tener su familia, poder tener ingresos para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Esau, 26, is single and lives with his parents. He has been working for two and a half years as a salesman in a store. When he finished high school, he was offered the opportunity to work there and did not think twice to start, despite his lack of experience. This is currently his only activity. His workplace is located 3 km away from home, but he travels to nearby cities as part of his job. He works from 7 am to 5 pm.

He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle, which will be useful since it will make it easier for him to go to work. Sometimes, unplanned things happen and he has to go to the city using public transport, which is an irregular service. This takes him all day. With a motorcycle, travel times will be less and he will not spend all day travelling. He travels around 45 km every day.

His dream for the future is to open his own business, more specifically a store since he has the required experience. He knows he will have to work hard for this, so that when the moment of having a family comes, he can have the necessary income in order to give them everything they need.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal, 48, is married with five dependent children, two of whom are still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Thmor Koul district, Battambang province. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and growing cabbage, while her husband helps to earn more income by working as a taxi-driver in the local area. Phal has been running her business for 12 years, earning about KHR47,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR22,000 each day.

Phal has been with VisionFund for two cycles and she has completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phal is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Residing in the Ponhea Leur District of Kandal Province, Sreysros is 19 years old. 

To make a living, she has been tailoring groom and bride clothing. The current business earns her about US $26 per day, but she can manage to save about US $10 each day after daily expenses. 

Sreysros has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund to pay for the tuition fee for three months, majoring in Wedding Embellishment. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a good business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fee for the three months.

loans.name: Guadalupe Eugenia

texts.es: Guadalupe de 35 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 11, 12 y 8 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, posee una tienda desde hace 4 años donde vende sopas, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, aceites, leches, etc. con las ganancias de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Guadalupe solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su tienda como: bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos etc. todo por mayor para surtir con mas productos y con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Doña Guadalupe is 35 and owns her own home, where she lives with her partner and their three children, ages 8, 11, and 12. The children are all currently in school. 

Doña Guadalupe has for four years run a shop where she sells soups, staple grains, soft drinks, snacks, cooking oil, milk, and other goods. The income from the store allows Doña Guadalupe to meet her household expenses. She's applying for a loan for the wholesale purchase of goods for her store, such as: drinks, snacks, staple grains, and other products. Doña Guadalupe hopes that a larger inventory will result in greater financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, snacks, staple grains, and other goods.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a member of this two-person lending group. She is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He is the only earning person in the family. The income generated from his work plays an important role to meet the family expenses. 

For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nasreen is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Yeakleng's Group

texts.en:
Yeakleng, 33, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district. She has three children to take care of and now they are still in school. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice and working as a paid construction worker for several years. The current business earns her family about 28,000 KHR per day.

There are four members in Yeakleng’s group and she is in her first microloan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and  to buy more grocery items for selling. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and to buy groceries to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods and food products to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods and food products.

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Residing in the Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province, Cheang is 47 years old and married. She has three sons, all of whom are still in school. She has struggled to make a living through farming rice, while her husband is a nurse who works in a local village. Having these businesses for almost 30 years, she is able to earn about 10,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to support her family’s needs.
 
Cheang has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, and now she is applying as a second-time borrower with VisionFund to pay for the school fee of her son to study nursing. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue the degree so as to find a good job after graduation and also help her to relieve her financial burdens.

loans.use: To pay for the school fee of her son to study nursing.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha is a citizen from a rural area located in Kandal Province’s Ponhea Leur District. He is a 26-year-old single man. 

To make a living, he has been working as a teacher for four years. The current job earns him about 16,000 KHR per day but he can manage to save about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Panha, who has never been with VisionFund before, is seeking his first loan. He is going to use this loan for paying the tuition fees for the four years of his bachelor degree majoring in history. This loan will enable him to have a good and bright future from these academic studies and earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees for four years.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Julia from Liberia. Precisely, she lives in Congo Town. She is married and  has nine children, aged from 23 to 35; all of them are living on their own. Her husband is not working. 

She completed 3rd grade before starting her business 20 years ago. She described herself as a hardworking woman. She used a little money from her susu (local daily savings) to establish her business. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit, and she likes the buying from customers. She sells for nine hours, six days in a week.

She is requesting a loan to buy more red fresh fish for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more. She would like to say thanks to BRAC Liberia and their supporters.

loans.use: to buy more red fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 63 years old and is widowed. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Dung runs a food stall that sell breads with pork to people in her commmunity. She intends to use her loan to expand her business by buying a greater range and quantity of breads and better quality of food to sell from her stall.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for facing difficulties in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of breads and better quality of food to sell.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Dambae district of Cambodia, Channy is 51 years old and married.  Channy has three children, one of whom is in school while the remaining two have their own businesses. She and her husband earn a living by planting cassava and farming rice. She has been in these businesses for years, and earns about US $6 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Channy has just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is requesting a loan to buy materials for repairing phones, and to buy more phones for her children's business. 

She hopes this loan will enable her children to increase their business and make more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing phones, and to buy more phones to support her children's business

loans.name: Kimlorn's Group

texts.en:
Kimlorn is 57 and married. She has five children. Her family lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband earn a living through working as construction workers and sometimes they work for others for a fee. 

Kimlorn is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy construction materials for supporting her husband's business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for supporting her husband's business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 45-year-old married man who lives in a small village of the Zestaponi district with his wife, his retired mother, his uncle and two children (16 and 19 years old). 

Zurab is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns three milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Besides, the family cultivates a small plot of land where various vegetables are grown. Zurab and his family members work hard all day long to earn their living but their existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses of such a large family.

That is why,Zurab decided to start his own business. All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Zurab applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

A loan of $3,000 will help him to purchase a minibus. Once the minibus is purchased, he will work on the minibus line and increase the family's income. With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on the minibus line.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a group member of a three-person lending group. She has asked for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's shop. He has been running a clothing shop. He purchases a variety of ladies and gents clothing from the factory and sells it in the main market. He is getting a good profit with this business. However, currently, he doesn't have enough savings to purchase more dresses to sell. Therefore, he would use the Kiva loan to purchase a variety of ladies and gents clothing. This will help him to continue his business. Shaheen hopes that the loan amount would be helpful for her husband. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

Shaheen raises her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ladies and gents clothing.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 46, is single. She has two sons and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She earns a living making and selling baby clothes. She has been in this business for 24 years. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying one more sewing machine to better satisfy her customers and increase her production.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Victor Omar

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 23 años,es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Victor no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Química que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Victor trabaja como operario en una bodega vitivinícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Victor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una cocina para su hogar, la cual reemplazara a su cocina de kerosene que presenta desperfectos y su uso es peligroso, así pues Victor seguirá trabajando y eforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old, single and lives in the city of Ica (in the Parcona district) with his parents and siblings.  He is very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic, and has a great desire to get ahead in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because he needed to work, Victor was unable to study Chemical Engineering as he had wanted.

Through his own initiative, Victor is a worker at one of the city's wineries.  He works every day for around ten hours per day and believes it is going well because of his dedication and how well he carries out his work.

Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support provided, he will be able to buy a stove for his home.  This will replace the current kerosene stove in the house, which has become problematic and dangerous.  So, with this loan, Victor will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve his big dream of owning a transport company.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 51 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей (1 дочь, 2 сына). Бактыгул имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о мягкой и жизнерадостной женщине. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Бактыгул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1999 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 7,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 3 дойные коровы. Ее хозяйство приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена накопить средства для дальнейшего образования детей в престижных учебных заведениях.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul is 51 years old, married, and is raising three children (1 daughter, 2 sons). Bakhtygul has a high school education. Her neighbors describe her as a soft and cheerful woman. Her husband and children help her around the farm. 

As a main source of income for her family, Bakhtygul has been involved since 1999 in raising livestock, starting with 7,000 som (KGS). She has quite a bit of experience in raising and caring for livestock. Thanks to her hard work, Bakhtygul has on her farm: three dairy cows. Her farm brings in about 12,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the basis for food costs and household needs of the family. 

With the goal of further expanding her farm, Bakhtygul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. 

Bakhtygul plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her farm, and in this way in the future intends to save money for the further education of her children in prestigious educational institutions.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Nshigikira Group

texts.fr:
Concilie fait partie du groupe  Nshigikira et  habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 40 ans et est mariée  à  Moise un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 5 à 17 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce de  bière   depuis  19 ans. 

Elle  est à son dixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  caisses de  bière, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Avec le gain de son commerce, elle parvient à nourrir sa famille, payer les frais scolaires des enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en:
Concilie is a member of the Nshigikira group and lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and married to Moise, a shopkeeper. Together they have 5 children ages 5 to 17 years. 

Concilie has been in the beer business for 19 years. She is on her tenth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she receives, she will increase her capital and purchase many cases of beer in order to resell them and increase her revenue. With the profit from her business, Concilie will be able to feed her family, pay for her children's schooling, and provide for their medical care.

loans.use: increase her business capital and purchase many cases of beer to resell in order to earn more profit

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Membre dès la mise en place du banc villageois, âgée de 66 ans  et mère de 10 enfants dont 5 filles, madame Fatou est une dame exemplaire dans la gestion de ses activités et dans la bonne marche du groupement depuis 2003.

Son activité consiste à la transformation de « nététou » c’est une graine végétale qu’on transforme comme assaisonnement traditionnel. Elle achète les graines à 300 F CFA le kilo auprès des villageois ou dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. Elle fait la transformation (lavage, cuissons, séchage, concassage). Elle revend le produit fini à 600 F CFA le kilo dans les autres régions particulièrement dans la capitale.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter une quinzaine de sacs de graines de cinquante kilos pour la transformation et la vente. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et assister son mari dans la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
A founding member of the "banc villageois," 66 years old and the mother of 10 children including 5 daughters, Fatou is a model businesswoman in her own business and has been ensuring the continued success of the group since 2003. Her business is processing "nététou", a vegetable seed that is processed into a traditional spice.

Fatou purchases the seeds at 300 francs CFA per kilo from villagers or in the outdoor markets in her region. She performs the processing (washing, cooking, drying, and crushing) and then resells the finished product at 600 francs CFA per kilo in other regions, particularly in the capital. 

With this new loan, Fatou plans to purchase 15 50-kg bags of seeds to process and resell them. With the profits, she hopes to improve the living conditions for her family and to help her husband in educating their children.

loans.use: purchase 15 50-kg bags of seeds for processing and resale

loans.name: Bubuamina

texts.ru: Бубуамине 49 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей (2 дочери, 1 сын). Бубуамина имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о мягкой и жизнерадостной женщине. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Бубуамина в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1995 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Бубуамины в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ее хозяйство приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубуамина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Бубуамина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена построить дом для сына.
texts.en:
Bubuamina is 49 years old, married, and is raising three children (two daughters, one son). Bubuamina has a high school education. Her neighbors speak of her as a soft and cheerful woman. Her husband and children help her around the farm. 

As a main source of income for her family, Bubuamina since 1995 has been involved in raising livestock, starting with 5,000 som (KGS). Her experience in raising and caring for cattle is quite big. Thanks to the hard work of Bubuamina, her homestead today has: two dairy cows. Her homestead brings in about 15,000 som (KGS) per month, that serves as the basis for to cover the costs of food and household needs of the family. 

В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Bubuamina turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows. Bubuamina plans to invest income from the loan to further increase her homestead, and in this way in the future intends to build a home for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria, age 58, of Malaubang, Ozamis City in the Philippines, is married and has five children. To earn a living, Elueteria and her husband operate a tailoring business, providing general alterations and tailoring services. Elueteria has been in this service for many years and earns 5,000 PHP per month from the business.

 In 2008, Elueteria joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and she successfully repaid her previous loan that helps a lot in running their business. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to finance repair of their sewing machines. She plans to use her revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair their sewing machines.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet  is married with five children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She has a business running a retail shop and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, maize flour, and rice, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She generates additional income through working as a part-time teacher. 

Janet works in her shop seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and ever increasing prices of goods in Uganda. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also owning a delivery van to ease transportation.   She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 35 years old, is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver for hire. Thuy earn a living running a food stall that serves breakfast to people in her community. She started this business four years ago. 

Thuy is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new appliances for her food stall and a motorcycle for going to and from the market. She hopes her business continues to run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new appliances for her food stall and a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 40, is married with one daughter. He lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns a living running a food stall that serves breakfast and fruit juice to people in his community. He started this business three years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying new appliances and a quantity of fruits to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new appliances and a quantity of fruits to better satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Minara

texts.ru: Минаре 29 лет, замужем, воспитывает 1 дочь. Минара имеет высшее образование,с  2010 года по сей день является работником почтового отделения. Супруг работает в милиции. Коллеги по работе описывают ее как: пунктуального, требовательного и ответственного человека. Минара в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2005 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря стойкому характеру и упорному труду Минары, в своем хозяйстве она имеет: 6 дойных коров и 15 овец. Ее хозяйство приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Минаре еще больше увеличить поголовье скота в своем хозяйстве. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Минара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Минара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена купить семейную автомашину.
texts.en:
Minara is 29 years old, married, and is raising one daughter. Minara has a higher education. Since 2010 to the present day, she has been a worker in the post office. Her husband works in the military police. Her work colleagues describe her as: a punctual, discerning, and responsible person. 

As an additional source of income for her family, Minara has been involved since 2005 in raising livestock, starting this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent character and hard work, Minara has on her farm: six dairy cows and 15 sheep. Her farm brings in about 6,000 som (KGS) per month. Income from farming allowed Minara to further increase the number of livestock on her farm.

Toward the goal of further developing her farm, Minara turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves. 

Minara plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her farm, and in this way in the future intends to buy a family vehicle.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Siah from Liberia. She operates a cook shop (restaurant) which sells 'fufu' (mashed manioc), rice, and soup in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

Siah is single and has a three-year-old child who stays at home.  She completed 12th grade.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

Siah has been running this cook shop for the past two years now.  She works 10 hours, six days a week at her business.  Her greatest challenge is not enough income. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, 'fufu', chicken, 'bonnie', dried meat, fish oil, peppers, etc. She started her business with a little money from her 'susu' (local savings).  She likes her business because of the profit she makes every time.  In the future, she wants to build a house.  
She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: buy more rice, 'fufu', chicken, 'bonnie', dried meat, fish oil, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, vive actualmente con su madre y su hermana, después de la muerte de su padre ha sido él quien ha  tomado la responsabilidad del hogar. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos y a la ganadería, dicha actividad la aprendió de su padre desde muy pequeño. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y para el fortalecimiento del ganado. Esta inversión le ayudara a tratar mejor al ganado, comprarle alimentación y asimismo para el mantenimiento  del cultivo de la postrera que posee, esto le generara mayores ingresos. 
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos currently lives with his mother and his sister. After the death of his father, he became the principal bread winner of the family. He works in agriculture, planting basic grains and raising livestock, activities he learned from his father as a child. The loan he is asking for will be used to purchase basic agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and to care for his livestock. This investment will help him to be able to treat his herd better, to buy them food and for the cultivation of his crops, all of which will help him to earn more money. His dream is to be able to give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and to help him care for his livestock.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen is 45 years old and is widowed. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Duyen runs a food stall where she sells vermicelli and sour crab soup to people in her community. She intends to use her loan to expand her business by buying a larger range and better quality of food to sell from her stall. she hopes that this will better satisfy her customers and attract additional customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will help her improve her family's living conditions and to save money to be able to face future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a larger range and better quality of food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: My

texts.en: My is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband support their family by running a food stall in front of their house. She has been running her business for the past seven years. She would like to take out a loan to buy more beverages to stock her stall, to sell to people in her community. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to stock her stall.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Savin is 36 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is a university student. Savin is a farmer and works in a garment factory while her husband is a motorcycle driver to supplement their income and support the family. Savin has been engaged in this business for several years. 

Savin has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles. Now she is applying for a new loan from VisionFund to pay for her daughter's university fees for the remaining four years. She hopes that this loan will enable her daughter at university to pursue her degree so she can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a citizen from a rural area located in Ponhea Leur of Kandal Province. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children. All of them are still in school and dependent on her. Sophorn is a teacher and a farmer, who grows rice on five hectares of farmland. She has been involved in the current business for 15 years. 

Sophorn is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan from VisionFund to cover the entire tuition fee for seven months for her daughter, who is specializing in wedding planning. Sophorn hopes that her daughter can graduate and get a job to make a good income to support her family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee for seven months for her daughter

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of seven. She has been running a business selling clothing for many years. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her neighborhood. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Parveen applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is from Bañadero, Ozamiz City. He is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He runs a general store in their community to make a living, while his wife work overseas. He joined Gata Daku MPC and took out a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more goods to sell, including sardines, soft drinks, rice and livestock feed. He plans to save his revenue for his children’s education. He wants his family to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, including sardines, soft drinks, rice and livestock feed.

loans.name: James Matthew

texts.en: James Matthew is studying his maritime course in Misamis University, Ozamiz City. He is 19 years old and lives with his parents in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. His father owns an auto shop while his mother runs a sari sari (retail) store to make a living. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC and took a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy school materials such as books and uniforms. He hopes he can finish his studies to have a chance to be successful and able to support his parents' needs someday.

loans.use: to buy school materials such as books and uniforms

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman appreciates the previous loan he took out from Kiva, which enabled him buy goats for his business. He also has a retail shop, selling household consumables to passersby and his neighbors. He is applying for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves, soap, beans and rice for his business. He joined Yehu for a financial support.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, tea leaves, soap, beans and rice for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.ru: Саадат 31 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей (3 дочери). Саадат имеет среднее образование. Саадат оптимистично смотрит и идет по жизни. Знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами, а также знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Супруг -мелкий предприниматель, также помогает по хозяйству. Саадат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2009 года занимается животноводство, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Саадат в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 9 овец. ЕЕ хозяйство приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саадат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребят. Доходы от кредита Саадат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена сделать ремонт дома, в котором проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Saadat is 31 years old, married, and is raising three daughters. Saadat has a high school education. Saadat has an optimistic outlook and life goes on. She knows exactly what she wants and achieves everything with her own strengths, but also knows how to properly use and plan funds for achieving her goals. 

Her husband, a small businessman, also helps around the farm. As the main source of income for the family, Saadat has been involved since 2009 in raising livestock, starting this business with 15,000 som (KGS). She has quite a lot of experience in breeding and caring for livestock. 

Thanks to hard work, Saadat has on her farm: two dairy cows and nine sheep. Her farm brings in about 6,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the basis for food expenses and the household needs of the family.

With the aim of further developing her farm, Saadat turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase foals. 

Saadat plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her farm, and in this way in the future intends to make repairs on the home in which she lives with her family.

loans.use: to buy foals

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as household items and food, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, will increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as household items and food, to restock her general store

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is requesting a new loan to buy hair-care products and equipment and she also would like to use part of her loan to pay for her children's school fees. Ly's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products and equipment, and pay for school fees

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es:
Elvia es una mujer de 66 años, trabajadora desde que era una niña, pues al no poder tener acceso a la educación secundaria, se dedicó a buscar el sustento por cuenta propia. Está casada con Segundo un agricultor de 71 años con quien formaron un hogar siendo muy jóvenes. Elvia vive con su esposo y su hija quien aporta para los gastos del hogar. Viven en el Cantón de Salcedo ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. En Salcedo existen varios atractivos turísticos como lagunas y balnearios que ofrecen deportes extremos para sus turistas aventureros, sin embargo la principal actividad que desarrollan en este pueblo es la agricultura y en menor cuantía la ganadería. Los productos agrícolas más comercializados son granos como arveja, fréjol, lenteja, haba y también varias frutas y verduras. La producción de leche y sus derivados abastece la distribución interna y el excedente se envía a la Región Costa en productos ya procesados. La crianza de animales es también muy favorable por el  clima agradable del que se goza en el Cantón. A pesar de estas actividades productivas, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares. 
Elvia se dedica desde hace 30 años a la crianza de animales domésticos como cuyes, cerdos conejos, pollos, codornices, etc  y además a la producción de tomate de árbol. Es un trabajo que le gusta mucho y por lo cual le dedica hasta 10 horas cada día, paralelamente a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar. Elvia ha adquirido la suficiente experiencia para paso a paso llevar su negocio hacia el crecimiento, sin embargo la falta de oportunidades de financiamiento no le han permitido surtir su negocio como ella quisiera, es por esto que ahora solicita un crédito con el cual comprará al menos un animal de cada tipo para incrementar sus utilidades y así poder aportar con los gastos de su hogar y tener un ahorro conveniente para los gastos de salud que implican el cuidado a su edad.  Elvia agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la oportunidad que le brindan de dar un nuevo paso de crecimiento en su negocio y motiva a los inversionistas de Kiva a seguir apoyando el emprendimiento y esfuerzo de las personas de América Latina y el mundo.
texts.en:
Elvia is 66 years old, and has been working since she was a young girl.  She did not have access to secondary education, and decided to seek a means of providing for her own livelihood.  She is married to Segundo, a farmer who is 71 years old.  They formed a home together when they were young.  Elvia lives with her husband and their daughter, who contributes to the home expenses.  They live in the canton of Salcedo, located in the western part of Cotopaxi, one of the most important provinces of the mountain area of Ecuador.  In Salcedo, there are various tourist attractions, like lagoons and spas, and they also offer extreme sports for adventurous tourists.

However, the main activity of the area is agriculture and, to a lesser extent, raising livestock.  The agricultural products that are marketed the most in this area are seeds and grains like peas, beans, lentils, broad beans, and different types of fruits and vegetables.  Milk and its derivatives are first dispersed internally, and the surplus is sent to the coastal region as processed products.  Raising animals is also favorable in this town due to the pleasant climate.  Despite these productive activities, there are worrying rates of illiteracy and poverty due to lack of basic needs, like a sewage system; only 25% of homes in this area have one.

For thirty years, Elvia has made a living raising domestic animals like guinea pigs, pigs, rabbits, chickens, quails, etc.  She also grows tree tomatoes.  She likes this work, and spends ten hours every day working while also performing household chores.  Elvia has sufficient experience to grow her business little by little.  However, the lack of financing opportunities has prevented her from supplying her business as she would like.

For this reason, she is now requesting a loan.  She will buy at least one of each type of animal in order to increase her profits and thereby be able to contribute some money to the home expenses.  She will also be able to have savings in order to cover health costs related to caring for herself as she gets older.  

Elvia thanks the Fundación Alternativa for the opportunity they have offered her to give her business new growth, and for encouraging the Kiva investors to continue supporting the projects and efforts of the people of Latin America and the world.

loans.use: to increase her supply of animals.

loans.name: Hireattta

texts.en: 27-year-old Hireattta operates a table selling fashion handbags, clothes, and slippers, in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most heavily populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is single and has an 11-year-old child who attends school and lives at home. She finished the twelfth grade, and she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as good businesswoman. Hireattta has had a table business for the past three years. She works 10 hours, six days a week, at her business. Her greatest challenge is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more fashion handbags, clothes, and slippers to resell. She started her business with the help of her fiancé, who is a businessman. She likes her business, because it helps her buy some items for the home. In the future, she wants to own a house. She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more fashion hand bags, clothes, and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more animals like goats to sell

loans.name: Sanh's Group

texts.en: Sanh, 51, lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To feed the family, Sanh and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice for 28 years, earning about 27,000 KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs. Sanh has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely repaid her past VisionFund loans. Sanh has used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood and keep her children in school. She is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Sanh is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her family’s business, and she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her family’s farm.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 32 years old, a married woman who has two children. Florence lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is purchasing food for her family.

For the past six years, Florence has operated an African wax-prints, batik and detergent business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. This is her sixth loan request from ID-Ghana and she has repaid previous loans without problem.

With the GHS 1200 loan amount, she wants to purchase African wax-prints, batiks and detergent to sell to customers. She decided to join ID-Ghana to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase African wax-prints, batiks and detergent to sell to customers.

loans.name: Torn's Group

texts.en: Torn, 59, is married and lives with his family in a village in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He has seven children. For the past twenty years, Torn and his wife have been farming rice and working as paid construction workers as the main sources of the family’s income. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day from the current businesses. Torn’s group consists of two members, and he is a first-cycle client of Kiva partner, VisionFund. Torn, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy materials for construction a proper latrine. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a decent latrine for his family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан 62 года, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей (2 дочери, 1 сын). Токтокан имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о доброжелательной и ответственной женщине. После смерти мужа Токтокан взяла себя в руки, стойко перенесла потерю мужа и взяла на себя всю ношу по уходу и обеспечению детей и благосостоянию семьи в целом. Старшая дочь замужем, проживает отдельно. Сын с младшей дочерью проживает с матерью. Токтокан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1989 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 1040 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также земельный надел, мерою 2, 25 ГА, на которой она выращивает пшеницу для продажи. Ее хозяйство приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтокан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена завершить строительство скотного сарая.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children (two daughters, one son). Toktokan has a high school education. Her neighbors describe her as a friendly and responsible woman. After the death of her husband, Toktokan pulled herself together, steadfastly endured the loss of her husband and took the whole burden of the care and welfare of her children and the well-being of the family as a whole. Her elder daughter is married and lives separately. Her son and younger daughter live with their mother. As the main source of income for her family, Toktokan has been engaged since 1989 in raising livestock and growing crops, starting this business with 1,040 som (KGS). She has quite a lot of experience with the breeding and care for livestock.

Thanks to her hard work, Toktokan has on her farm: two dairy cows, and also an allotment measuring 2.25 hectares, on which she grows wheat for sale. Her farm brings in about 5,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the basis for food expenses and household needs for the family. 

With the aim of further developing her farm, Toktokan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase of calves for further fattening and resale. 

Toktokan plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her farm, and in this way intends in the future to complete the construction of a cattle shed.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es una joven de 24 años de edad ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 2 hijos los cuales están en la escuela en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene 3 años de educación primaria y en compañía de su compañero de hogar trabajan la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café que además de ello también cultivan maíz y frijol productos que son vendidos a los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto de calidad y a un buen precio. Los cultivos están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde ella habita, esto facilita las diferentes actividades como la limpieza, el abono, riego, corta, etc. al final de cada cosecha.

Actualmente uno de los mayores desafíos es la baja de los precios en el mercado y el alza de los insumos para su mantenimiento por lo cual ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara: 13 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 8 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0, 6 QQ de ferty café, 8 kilos de nutrí café y 6 bolsas de positrón con los cuales protegerá y dará un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder extender más sus cosechas comprando más tierras y sembrar una mejor y más atractiva variedad. Sus sueños es poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad, que se especialicen en una carrera que los convierta en profesionales exitosos y pueden tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a 24-year-old housewife and farmer, with 2 children who are at school in different grades of education. She has had 3 years of primary education and along with her live-in partner she works in agriculture. She specialises in growing coffee and also grows corn and beans, products which are sold to various buyers who visit the area looking for products of a good quality and price. The crops are located in the property where she lives and she carries out the various tasks such as clearing the land, applying fertilizer, watering, pruning etc. at the end of each harvest. 

At present one of the biggest challenges is the fall of prices in the marketplace and the rising cost of the supplies she needs to maintain the crops. This is why Vicenta has asked the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan which she will use to buy coffee fertilisers: 13 quintals of formula 12-24-12, 8 quintals of formula 18-46-0, 6 quintals of ferty café, 8 kilos of nutri café and 6 bags of positrón which she will use to protect and nurture her crops.

Her plans for the future are to increase her harvests by buying more land and to grow a better, more attractive variety. Her dream is to be able to send her children to university so they can follow a specialised course to become successful professionals and can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing her coffee.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a 34-year-old lady who is applying for a loan of UGX 600,000 in her first loan cycle. She is a single mother of two children, who she looks after with the help of her young sister. She occupies a single room in her parents’ home in the outskirts of the city, and she sells second-hand clothes in order to survive. She moves from market to market on various days to sell the clothes, but she has always been challenged by her limited capital. Because of this challenge, she has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 to give her business a boost and to be able to meet client demand, especially for those who place orders and prefer to make payment after delivery. She has hopes that, given the loan, she will be able to make more sales and, some day, find it easier to look after her children and to construct a decent residence for her family. She is hardworking. In the photo are Eva (the client) and Michael, the Ugafode staff member for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Tahiya

texts.en:
Tahiya is a 52-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working in selling clothes for fourteen years. Her business is going well but needs external support to expand and develop. Tahiya is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a specialty collection. Her loan will allow her to meet most of her customers' requests.
This is Tahiya's third loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good payback history. Her previous loan was invested in increasing her summer collection, and it had an excellent impact on both her social and financial situations.
Tahiya hopes that in the future she can make necessary decorations at her shop to impress her customers and attract new ones.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a specialty collection

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 25 años de edad, está casada con Rivert quien es obrero y padre de su única hija de 5 años de edad, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Isabel se dedica a la venta de esmaltes, pulseras, collares, aretes, entre otros. También alquila un mototaxi ya que debe generarse mayores ingresos. Se inició hace más de 2 años en este negocio, comprando sus materiales en pocas cantidades, luego viendo que aumentaba la demanda de sus productos, fue aumentando sus compras, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Decidió empezar con sus actividades porque no contaba con sus suficientes ingresos económicos.Por tanto viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo desea en un futuro abrir un salón de belleza en su casa, y poder atender con total comodidad a sus clientes. Este será su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles comprará los materiales para la elaboración de sus pulseras, collares y aretes, además de la compra de esmaltes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 25 years old.  She is married to Rivert, who is a laborer.  They have a 5 year old daughter and they live together in the house they own.  

Isabel works selling nail polish, bracelets, necklaces, and earrings.  She also rents a mototaxi since that generates more profits.  She started her business more than two years ago, purchasing her materials in small quantities.  Later, as demand increased for her products, she increased her purchases, and she does all the work alone.  She decided to start this work because she did not have enough income.  She is seeing good results and hopes in the future to open a beauty salon in her home and be able to care for her customers comfortably.  

This will be her sixth loan with Kiva.  She feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to move forward.  She promises to make her repayments on time.

With the requested loan of 800 nuevos soles, she will purchase material to make her bracelets, necklaces, and earrings, and also purchase nail polish.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish and materials to make earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo crédito porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para el cultivo de maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo al fortalecimiento del negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar a su familia. Su deseo es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y continuar trabajando en la tierra.
texts.en:
Mario finds himself in need of a new loan because he needs more working capital to grow corn and beans. This loan will help him to buy necessary agricultural supplies such as herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, fertilizer and other items.

The previous loan helped him to strengthen his business and with the profits he has been able to support his family. His dream is to help his children in their studies and carry on working the land.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, fertilizer and other items.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
Carlos, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar con el cultivo de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas,   insecticidas, entre otros.
Menciona el Sr. Carlos que con el crédito anterior logro adquirir los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de una manzana de tierra de maíz y una de frijol; asimismo con las ganancias ha logrado aportar a su familia. Su deseo es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y continuar con el cultivo.
texts.en:
Carlos needs to request a new loan since he needs more working capital to continue with his cultivation of basic grains.  This investment will help him purchase the necessary farm supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, plaguicides, insecticides, and others items.

Carlos says that his last loan allowed him to acquire the agricultural supplies for a field of corn and one of beans.  The income that he earned is supporting his family.  His dream is to support his children with their studies and to continue farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, plaguicides, insecticides, and other items.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей (2 дочери, 1 сын). Дети все учатся в школе. Основной деятельностью Айнуры является разведение мелкого рогатого скота. С 2000 года стала заниматься животноводством, на это есть все условия для содержания скота. В этом деле ей помогает муж, он тоже хорошо разбирается в этом. Бизнес Айнура начала с 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Айнура достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айнуры имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует купить автомашину.
texts.en:
Ainura is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children (2 daughters, 1 son). The children are all in school. Ainura's main activity is raising short-horned livestock. In the year 2000, she became involved in raising livestock because she has all the needed conditions for livestock. She is helped in this work by her husband; he is also well-versed in this. Ainura's business started with 30,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to her backbreaking labor and capacious work, Ainura achieved a little success in developing her farm and has been receiving a monthly profit of 8,000 som (KGS). Today, Ainura has on her farm: two dairy cows and one calf. 

In order to further develop her farm, Ainura turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow with calf. 

Ainura plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the count of livestock on her farm, and in this way to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow with calf

loans.name: Alymkan

texts.ru: Алымкан 59 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей (2 дочери, 1 сын). Старшие дети живут отдельно, младший с родителями. Основной деятельностью Алымкан является разведение скота. С 1998 года стала заниматься животноводством, на это есть все условия для содержания скота. В этом деле ей помогает муж и сын. Бизнес Алымкан начала с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Алымкан достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Алымкан имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алымкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком. Доходы от кредита Алымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en:
Alymkan is 59 years old, married, and the mother of three children (2 daughers, 1 son). The elder children live separately, and the youngest with the parents. Alymkan's main activity is raising cattle. In 1998, she started to engage in raising livestock, as he had all the needed conditions to tend cattle. She is helped in this work by her husband and son. 

Alymkan's business began with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her backbreaking labor and capacious work, Alymkan reached some small success in developing her farm and began to receive a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). Today, Alymkan has on her farm: two dairy cows and one calf.

With the aim of further developing her farm, Alymkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow with calf. 

Alymkan plans to invest income from the loan in further expanding the count of livestock on her farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow with calf

loans.name: Emanuel Tonala Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luz es divorciada, tiene 30 años de edad, de escolaridad secundaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de bisuteria, inició este negocio con el apoyo de sus padres y por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para ella y para su hijo; hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar y surtir mercadería para la venta, desea en el futuro ver su negocio reconocido y bien establecido y surtido cada día y obtener mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Maria Luz is 30 years old, divorced, and completed secondary school.  She has one son who is in school.  She works selling costume jewelry.  She started this business with the support of her parents because she needed to generate income for herself and her son.  She now has five years of experience.  She counts on the support of her parents.  

She organized a group and requested a loan to purchase and stock her merchandise for sale.  She hopes in the future to make her business more well-known and established.  It will be stocked every day and earn more profits.  The other group members work as merchants.

loans.use: to purchase and sell costume jewelry.

loans.name: Ma Romana

texts.es:
Doña Romana es una mujer de 45 años de edad casada la cual goza de una excelente salud suficiente energía y muchos ánimos para trabajar. En la comunidad es caracterizada por una mujer amable, respetuosa y servicial la cual trabaja junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos. En familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café ya que ella aprendió desde pequeña en compañía de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que no pudieron apoyarla en sus estudios porque eran de escasos recursos económicos entonces ella decidió aprender a trabajar y ayudarle a su familia para salir adelante, los ingresos por parte del trabajo de la tierra son pocos y la distribución económica era específicamente para la alimentación. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a una hora de camino desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan pie. Sus sueños como madre de familia es poder educar a sus hijos para que ellos puedan vivir en buenas condiciones y darles una mejor y mayor calidad de vida con un nivel educativo superior.

Doña Romana solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para  la compra de 4 QQ de urea, 4 QQ de abono 18-46-0, 4 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 1 litro de daconil, 10 QQ de gallinaza entre otros para poder asistir sus cultivos y obtener una mejor producción y una mejor ganancia de la venta de la misma.
texts.en:
Doña Romana is 45 years old, married, and is in great health with a lot of energy and desire to work. In her community, she is characterized as a friendly, respectful, and selfless woman, who works together with her son and their 5 children. The family works planting and cultivating coffee, which Doña Romana learned as a small girl in the company of her parents. They taught her how to work the earth as they could not support her with her studies due to the family's scarce economic resources. As a result, she dedicated herself to her work in order to help her family get ahead, although the income that she makes is very little and used mostly to purchase food. Her coffee crops are located about an hour away from her house by foot. Her dream as a mother is to be able to educate her children so they can live in better conditions one day, and to give them a better quality of life.

Doña Romana is asking COMIXMUL for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and other chemical products in order to best tend her coffee crops. She hopes to obtain a better production and greater income as a result.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for cultivating coffee

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en:
Ioseb is 41-year-old married man who lives in a small village of Sachkhere district with his wife and three school-age sons. Ioseb is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a milking cow, whose milk is used to produce cheese. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Besides that, Ioseb is a joiner and works on special orders. 
His small earnings can cover food and everyday expenses. That is why Ioseb decided to start his own business. All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ioseb applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $3,100 will help him to purchase a minibus. Once the minibus is purchased, he will transport passengers on the minibus line from his district to another. This will significantly increase the family income.  With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and transport passengers on the minibus line

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: don Hernán de 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, él  se dedica a la carpintería  elabora puertas, muebles de sala, de comedor, roperos, gabeteros, etc. desde hace varios años, es una persona humildes, dedicada, trabajadora y honesta con sus clientes,  posee gran demanda por su buen trabajo, su mercadería la vende con comerciales que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a sus trabajo ha logrado solventar  algunos de sus gastos familiares, don Hernán solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales como madera, clavos, barniz, pegamento, etc.  y maquinaria que le hace falta para continuar con sus labores de carpintería, y así satisfacer la demanda de sus productos, y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Hernán is fifty years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their three children.  For several years, he has been making a living in carpentry, making doors, living room furniture, dining room furniture, wardrobes, dressers, etc.  He is a humble, dedicated, and hardworking person who is always honest with his clients.  There is a lot of demand for his good work, and he sells his merchandise at business centers that are located close to where he lives.  Thanks to this work, he has been able to cover some of his family's expenses.

Hernán is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials, like wood, nails, varnish, glue, etc. and machinery.  He needs these items in order to continue with his carpentry services, thereby satisfying the demand for his products and giving his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish, glue, etc. and carpentry machinery.

loans.name: Dúo  Solidario Patzicia Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario Patzicia. este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Mercedes de 54 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza(cosmeticos), se ha dedica a hesta actividad desde hace 25 años ya que gracias a Dios le dio la oportunidad de tener su negocioto, le da gracias a Kiva por la ayuda que le han brindado en los credito ya que ha sido de mucha bendicion para ella y su negocio, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de belleza(cosmeticos) para la venta, y esperando que ustedes nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Maria Mercedes, 54, is a member of the communal bank "Duo Solidario Patzicia."   She has a business selling beauty products.  She's had the business for 25 years, because thanks to God she was given the opportunity to have her own business.  She gives thanks to Kiva for the help that she's been provided with in the form of these loans, which has been a great blessing to her and her business.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy beauty products (cosmetics) to sell, and she's hoping that once again you will help her out with a loan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products (cosmetics) to sell

loans.name: James Matthew

texts.en:
James Matthew is studying his maritime course in Misamis University, Ozamiz City. He is 19 years old and lives with his parents in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. His father owns an auto shop while his mother runs a "sari sari" store to make a living. 

He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan to buy school materials like books and uniforms. He took another loan of 13,500 PHP to pay for his school tuition fees. 

He hopes he can finish his studies to have a chance to be successful and able to support his parents' needs someday.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition fees

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат целеустремленная женщина. Ей 49 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет  3 детей. Детям 29, 26, 19 лет. Они постепенно помогают родителям по домохозяйству. Мухаббат более 12 лет занимается скотоводством. Она имеет 3 голов коровы. Ее муж Аскар помогает ей введению бизнеса. Мухаббат хочет отремонтировать свой дом, а точнее отремонтировать крышу дома, так как во время дождя течет с крыши ее дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки цемента и шифера. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a driven woman. She is 49 years old, married, and is the mother of three children. The children are aged 29, 26, and 19. They help their parents around the farm as they are able. For more than 12 years, Muhabbat has been involved in raising livestock. She has three heads of cattle. Her husband Askar helps her to run the business. 

Muhabbat wants to make repairs on her home, more specifically to repair the roof, since when it rains it runs off the roof into her home. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to purchase cement and slate.

loans.use: to buy slate and cement for repairing her house

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет в сельской местности, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у нее проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут Наргиза.  Ей 32 года, замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 6  лет она занимается скотоводством. У нее большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Она продает скот, за которым она присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Наргиза хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A person with a huge heart and a beautiful soul who lives in a rural area has need of support since she has financial problems. Her name is Nargiza. She is 32 years old, married, and is the mother of three children. 

Her environment is very favorable for raising crops and livestock. For more than six years, she has been engaged in animal husbandry. She has a large garden, where she grows hay for cattle. She sells livestock for which she has cared over the course of several months. In the market, she has many customers. 

Nargiza wanst to develop her business, but she does not have enough money for this. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase cattle, in order to increase her working capital. With the earned revenue, she is going to provide her children with a good education and modern technology.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат энергичная и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 31 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Фарогат более 13 лет работает в доме культуре и у нее стабильная зарплата. Ее муж работает строителем и имеет маленький доход. Так как они имеют маленькую зарплату, так и не могут сделать сбережения для того, чтобы провести церемонию обрезания своего сына. Фарогат запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения церемония обрезания своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Farogat is an energetic and happy woman.  She is 31 years old, married and raising two adolescent children.  Farogat has been working at a cultural department for over 13 years and has a stable income.  Her husband works as a construction worker and has a small salary.  Because they have small salaries, they cannot save enough to hold a circumcision ceremony for their son.  Farogat is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo crédito para iniciar la siembra de granos básicos y así para el fortalecimiento del mismo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas oportunos, tales como: abono, venenos y fertilizantes, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar la productividad y sus ingresos económicos, estos los invierte en la compra de alimentos básicos para el hogar. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado porque fortaleció el cultivo y obtuvo ingresos favorables; su grupo familiar se mantiene el mismo.
texts.en:
María finds the need to ask for another loan to start sowing basic grains and to look after the crops. This loan will help her to buy the right agricultural supplies such as manure, poisons and fertilisers and other items.

The previous loan helped her to increase her productivity and her income, which she used to buy basic foodstuffs for her household. Her economic situation has improved because she improved her production and got a better income. This supports her family.
